clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of CNAP PPV Under General Anaesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Non-invasive CNAP Pulse Pressure Variation With the Invasive Gold Standard

brief_summary.textblock:
Noninvasive pulse pressure variation for the guidance of perioperative fluid therapy is compared with the gold standard of invasive measurements. Cardiac output is derived by the PICCO monitor.
Hypothesis: Noninvasive CNAP PPV predicts fluid responsiveness. A grey zone for the prediction of fluid responsiveness will be defined.

detailed_description.textblock: Accuracy of PPV measured by two devices,PICCO and CNAP, is compared with the manually calculated PPV from the arterial line waveform. Established tests like passive leg raising and end-expiratory occlusion are used for prediction of fluid responsiveness. Intraoperative events like volume challenge are monitored.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1, 2, 5, 10, 15 and 20 minutes after volume challange and
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of cardiac output dependent on PPV before volume challenge

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing major surgery with the need for invasive arterial pressure monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- major surgery
- need for invasive arterial measurements
Exclusion Criteria:
- age under 18
- cardiac dysrhythmia
- vascular pathology at punction site
